DOC.criteria: 1. type 2 diabetes 2 . HbA1c > 6.5 % < 11.0 % 3. male/nonpregnant , nonlactating female , least 6 month postpartum 4. female childbearing potential , practice method birth control 5 . Body Mass Index > 18.5 kg/m2 < 43.0 kg/m2 . 6. weight stable past two month 7. antihypertensive , lipidlowering , thyroid medication hormone therapy , dosage constant least two month 1. us injected medication ( e.g. , insulin , exenatide ) glucose control . 2. history diabetic ketoacidosis 3. current infection ; inpatient surgery , corticosteroid treatment last 3 month antibiotic last 3 week 4. active malignancy 5. state he/she significant cardiovascular event < 12 week prior study entry history congestive heart failure last 12 month . 6. end stage organ failure 7. active metabolic , hepatic , gastrointestinal disease may interfere nutrient absorption , distribution , metabolism , excretion ( gastroparesis ) , exclude diabetes . 8. chronic , contagious , infectious disease , active tuberculosis , Hepatitis B C , HIV . 9. use herbal , dietary supplement , medication , allow medication , past four week could profoundly affect blood glucose . 10. symptomatic response blood collection prior enrollment study . 11. clot bleeding disorder . 12. nontypical eat pattern 13. currently use diabetesspecific nutritional product ( ) define one eat occasion per week . 14. engages strenuous exercise five time per week .
